bank: A financial institution where people deposit or borrow money.
To tilt an aircraft or vehicle during a turn.
bat: A piece of sports equipment used in baseball or cricket.
To hit something, usually with a quick motion.
spring: A season after winter and before summer.
A natural source of water emerging from the ground.
A coiled object that returns to its shape after being compressed.
light: Electromagnetic radiation that can be perceived by the human eye.
current: A flow of electricity or water.
A movement of air or energy in a particular direction.
rock: A solid mineral material forming part of the earth's surface.
To move gently back and forth.
watch: A small timepiece worn on the wrist.
To look at or observe attentively.
A period of surveillance or guard duty.
match: A stick for producing a flame.
A person or thing equal to another in quality or strength.
train: A series of connected railway cars.
To teach or instruct over time.
A sequence or series of events.
can: To be able to do something.
To preserve food in a sealed container.
set: To place or put something down.
bear: A large mammal with thick fur.
break: A pause in work or activity.
point: A sharp end of an object.
To indicate or direct attention toward something.
A unit of scoring in a game.
seal: An animal that lives in the ocean.
A device or substance used to join two things together.
bark: The outer covering of a tree.
The sharp sound made by a dog.
nail: A thin pointed metal pin used in construction.
The hard covering at the tips of fingers and toes.
To fasten something with a nail.
hello: A greeting (salutation) said when meeting someone or acknowledging someone’s arrival or presence.
need: A requirement for something; something needed.
Lack of means of subsistence; poverty; indigence; destitution.
i: The name of the Latin-script letter I.
my: Used to express surprise, shock or amazement.
khan: A ruler over various Turkish, Tatar and Mongol peoples in the Middle Ages.
A noble or man of rank in various Muslim countries of Central Asia, including Afghanistan.
happy: A happy event, thing, person, etc.
Preceded by the: happy people as a group.
Often followed by up: to become happy; to brighten up, to cheer up.
rest: (of a person or animal) Relief from work or activity by sleeping; sleep.
Any relief from exertion; a state of quiet and relaxation.
Peace; freedom from worry, anxiety, annoyances; tranquility.
sky: The atmosphere above a given point, especially as visible from the ground during the day.
The part of the sky which can be seen from a specific place or at a specific time; its condition, climate etc.
fall: The act of moving to a lower position under the effect of gravity.
A reduction in quantity, pitch, etc.
The time of the year when the leaves typically fall from the trees; autumn; the season of the year between the autumnal equinox and the winter solstice.
car: A wheeled vehicle that moves independently, with at least three wheels, powered mechanically, steered by a driver and mostly for personal transportation.
A wheeled vehicle, drawn by a horse or other animal; a chariot.
An unpowered unit in a railroad train.
exist: (stative) to be; have existence; have being or reality
you: To address (a person) using the pronoun you (in the past, especially to use you rather than thou, when you was considered more formal).
(object pronoun) The people spoken, or written to, as an object.
because: (by ellipsis) Used alone to refuse to provide a full answer a question begun with "why", usually taken as an anapodoton of the elided full phrase "Because I said so".
